_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary

Facility: Trotter Fertilizer and Propane
City:Ord, NE.
Contact:John Felton
Phone:308-728-7722

1. Facility Policy.

      The owners, management, and employees of Trotter Fertilizer and Propane are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department,Valley County LEPC, and other authorities, to mitigate any release and impact of the release to persons and the environment.

2. Facility Information.

      The primary activity at the facility is the storage of fertilizers and propane for sale to farmers. Anhydrous ammonia is received, stored and distributed for the direct application as a vutrient for crop production. The maximum stored would be pounds in a storage tand and nurse tanks.    
      
3. Accidental Release Prevention Program.

      The facility is in compliance with the provisions of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, K-61.1", published by The American National Standards Institute, In,. (ANSI), and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) , 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". The OSHA standard is referenced in this RMP Registration Form, see Section 8.3 (b).

4.Five-year Accident History.

      There have been no reportable accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility;nor, to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries,evacuation, property damage, or environmental damage.

5. Emergency Responce Program. 

      The Facility has:
      a. A written action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 29 CFR 1910.38;

      b.Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and community right-to-know information as required under S

ARA Title III (EPCRA).

6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety.

       Safety improvements are an on-going process at this facility. periodic evaluations are performed to assess the maintenance and safe conditions of our equipment. There are no additional specific anhydrous ammonia safety recommendations at this time.

7. For further Information contact; John  Felton at (308) 728-7722
